boat.name: Witch
boat.full_description:
‘Witch’ is a 36' auxiliary gaff cutter built by Charles Sibbick & Co in Cowes, 1902 for Mr T G Wills Sandford. She went to Ireland for at least the first few years, based at Dun Laoghaire, where Mr Wills Sandford was a member of the Royal St George and Royal Alfred Yacht Clubs. Most of her life has been spent on the English East Coast in Essex and Kent.

'Witch' was saved from being broken up by Colin and Cary Marsh in 1971 and was moored in Yarmouth Harbour at the western end of the Isle of Wight until 2006. All her previous owners are known from records on the Lloyds Register of Yachts.
boat.short_description:
Marine author Basil Lubbock owned 'Witch' from 1913 - 1921. After his first sail he wrote: “Very pleased with the behavior of 'Witch' - showed good speed”. Since 2006, she had been undergoing a major restoration.

Along with a number of other important craft, 'Witch' was lost in a major fire in Cowes Monday 25 January 2016.
